TITLE: A small summer Covid wave may be ahead, experts say, as a new variant takes over
SUMMARY: The variant, called KP.2, now makes up the largest share of new infections in the U.S

TITLE: The WHO overturned dogma on how airborne diseases spread. Will the CDC act on it?
SUMMARY: A new report comes as the CDC is updating its guidance for infection control. A committee advising the agency seems poised to brush the latest science aside

TITLE: Covid vaccines not linked to sudden death in young people, CDC report finds
SUMMARY: The new report debunks widespread misinformation that the mRNA shots were connected to sudden cardiac death in young athletes

TITLE: Health workers fear it's profits before protection as CDC revisits airborne transmission
SUMMARY: The agency is developing a crucial set of guidelines that health care facilities will use to control the spread of infectious diseases for years to come

TITLE: Georgia puts Willie Pye to death in its first execution since before the pandemic
SUMMARY: Pye, 59, was convicted of murder and other charges in the 1993 slaying of his former girlfriend. The state had paused executions, last carrying one out in January 2020

TITLE: CDC updates Covid 5-day isolation guidelines as deaths and hospitalizations fall
SUMMARY: The shift in guidance comes as Covid hospitalizations and deaths continue to fall

TITLE: CDC recommends spring Covid booster for older adults
SUMMARY: People 65 and older should get another shot to protect against the virus, the agency said Wednesday

TITLE: CDC may recommend a spring Covid booster for some groups
SUMMARY: People who are most vulnerable to Covid complications, such as older people and those with weak immune systems, may be able to get another dose for protection

TITLE: CDC says it has no plans to ease Covid isolation yet, despite urging from doctors
SUMMARY: Public health is “more than controlling one virus,” one expert said, as federal health officials consider their next steps in the pandemic

TITLE: In a break with CDC, California quietly changed its Covid isolation guidelines
SUMMARY: People in California no longer need to stay home if they’re symptom-free. Oregon implemented the same guidance in May
